Biology_40_r$Biology_226_p$Biology_407_r.text:
Finding A: The study found that, on average, Bifidobacterium were established earlier and more frequently in infants fed by women with an active copy of the gene, the secretors, than without one, the non-secretors.
Finding B: Increases in infectiousness as the fungus grows on hibernating bats may drive winter transmission, with loads increasing throughout the winter.
Finding C: "The combination of in vitro and in vivo experimental models to understand the biophysical and molecular mechanisms of primary blast injury and the effects of treatment on the BBB offer a powerful set of tools to guide the development of novel therapeutic strategies to mitigate the consequences of bTBI," says Morrison.
Finding D: Interesting article on violent video games not linked to teen aggression. @username you might be interested in this While games can cause frustration and anger, playing video games doesn't lead to aggression in every day life.

Biology_403_p$Biology_tweet_211_p$Biolog.text:
Finding A: We suggest that wild and domestic goats, and possibly other ungulates, lack sophisticated forms of social learning, because individual and simple social learning mechanisms are probably more efficient for improving their survival or reproductive success .
Finding B: Our data (1) confirm excess burden of genome-wide rare genic CNVs in an independent set of ASD subjects versus control subjects; (2) further reveal an extreme degree of etiological heterogeneity (36 different genetic loci were found among 82 individuals with pathogenic CNVs); (3) confirm the contribution of de novo CNVs to the etiology of autism and highlight the contribution of inherited pathogenic imbalances (36%); (4) show an increased proportion of females among carriers of highly penetrant pathogenic CNVs, as well as among carriers of deletions affecting FMRP targets; show no significant difference in the frequency of de novo CNVs between simplex and multiplex families; show that both deletions and duplications involving FMRP targets and PSD genes increase ASD risk; (7) show evidence of multigene contributions to ASD; show that ASD-associated deletions impair synapse function and neurodevelopmental processes; (9) implicate chromatin and transcription regulation genes in ASD in a network analysis of de novo CNVs; and show that genes affected by de novo CNVs and de novo LoF SNVs converge on functional gene networks.
Finding C: Overall, the researchers found that the SIK1 protein delays the body clock\'s shifting response to time changes, and therefore causes complications for travelers and shift workers.
Finding D: Body composition analysis showed that SIRT1 LKO mice had increased fat mass without changed lean mass.
Biology_403_p$Biology_tweet_211_p$Biolog.displayed_text:
Finding A: We suggest that wild and domestic goats, and possibly other ungulates, lack sophisticated forms of social learning, because individual and simple social learning mechanisms are probably more efficient for improving their survival or reproductive success .
Finding B: Our data (1) confirm excess burden of genome-wide rare genic CNVs in an independent set of ASD subjects versus control subjects; (2) further reveal an extreme degree of etiological heterogeneity (36 different genetic loci were found among 82 individuals with pathogenic CNVs); (3) confirm the contribution of de novo CNVs to the etiology of autism and highlight the contribution of inherited pathogenic imbalances (36%); (4) show an increased proportion of females among carriers of highly penetrant pathogenic CNVs, as well as among carriers of deletions affecting FMRP targets; show no significant difference in the frequency of de novo CNVs between simplex and multiplex families; show that both deletions and duplications involving FMRP targets and PSD genes increase ASD risk; (7) show evidence of multigene contributions to ASD; show that ASD-associated deletions impair synapse function and neurodevelopmental processes; (9) implicate chromatin and transcription regulation genes in ASD in a network analysis of de novo CNVs; and show that genes affected by de novo CNVs and de novo LoF SNVs converge on functional gene networks.
Finding C: Overall, the researchers found that the SIK1 protein delays the body clock\'s shifting response to time changes, and therefore causes complications for travelers and shift workers.
Finding D: Body composition analysis showed that SIRT1 LKO mice had increased fat mass without changed lean mass.
